title: "Or", "and"
context: §1-18 &ldquo;Or&rdquo;, &ldquo;and&rdquo;. Each of the terms &ldquo;or&rdquo; and &ldquo;and&rdquo;, has the meaning of the other or of both. [PC 1869, c 1, §4; RL 1925, §15; RL 1935, §16; RL 1945, §15; am L 1945, c 233, §2; RL 1955, §1-23; HRS §1-18] Case Notes Applied: 230 F. Supp. 455; 17 H. 135, 141; 34 H. 935, 941. &ldquo;And&rdquo; deemed conjunctive, not alternative. 33 H. 98, 101. &ldquo;Or&rdquo; deemed alternative, not conjunctive, penal statute. 44 H. 601, 604, 359 P.2d 289. Applied in substituting &ldquo;and&rdquo; for &ldquo;or&rdquo; in public accountancy statute. 51 H. 80, 452 P.2d 94. &ldquo;Or&rdquo; deemed &ldquo;and&rdquo;. 54 H. 356, 507 P.2d 169. Use of word &ldquo;and&rdquo; is not necessarily decisive. 56 H. 675, 548 P.2d 268. Cited: 52 F.2d 411, 414; 5 H. 52, 53; 19 H. 393, 397.
